meanings.definition: A section of a prison consisting of multiple cells.
meanings.sent1: The guards patrolled the cellblocks to ensure the safety of the inmates.
meanings.sent2: The new prisoners were assigned to different cellblocks based on their security level.
meanings.sent3: The escape artist claimed he could navigate the cellblocks blindfolded.
meanings.sent4: The cellblocks stood like silent sentinels, holding the secrets of the incarcerated.
meanings.sent5: The dimly lit cellblocks echoed with the sounds of restless prisoners.

meanings.definition: The area in which prisoners are housed in a correctional facility.
meanings.sent1: Visitors were not allowed in the cellblocks without proper authorization.
meanings.sent2: The cellblocks were overcrowded, leading to tensions among the inmates.
meanings.sent3: The cellblocks were so quiet that even a pin drop could be heard.
meanings.sent4: The cellblocks resembled a maze, confusing even the most seasoned guards.
meanings.sent5: The cellblocks were a stark reminder of the consequences of criminal behavior.
